indications: Indications primary and secondary carnitine deficiency
name: CARNITINE
cautions:
Cautions diabetes mellitus; monitoring of free and acyl carnitine in blood
and urine recommended
side-effects:
Side-effects nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, diarrhoea, body
odour; side-effects may be dose-related—monitor tolerance during first
week and after any dose increase
doses:
Primary deficiency, by mouth, up to 200 mg/kg
daily in 2–4 divided doses; usual max. 3 g daily; by intravenous
injection over 2–3 minutes, up to 100 mg/kg daily in 2–4 divided doses

Secondary deficiency, by intravenous injection over 2–3 minutes, 20 mg/kg after each dialysis session (dosage adjusted
according to plasma-carnitine concentration); maintenance
(if benefit gained from first intravenous course), by mouth, 1 g daily
pregnancy:
Pregnancy appropriate to use; no evidence of teratogenicity
in animal studies
